# Schedule {#schedule}

So we have 3 days, \~5 sessions with one "project/free-for-all" session.

The workshop is structured as a series of participatory live-coding
sessions (instructor and learner coding together) interspersed with
hands-on exercises and group work, using a real-world dataset or
applying the skills learned to your own datasets. There are some
lectures given, mainly at the start and end of the workshop. The general
schedule outline is shown in the below table.

```{r schedule-table, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, eval=TRUE}
options(knitr.kable.NA = "")
library(dplyr)
library(gt)
fa_link <- function(icon, link) {
    if (icon == "")
        return(html(""))
    html(paste0("<a href=\"", link, "\">", as.character(fontawesome::fa(icon, fill = "#cb4335")), "</a>"))
}
schedule <- readr::read_csv(here::here("resources/schedule.csv"),
                            col_types = "ccccc") %>% 
        mutate(across(everything(), ~if_else(is.na(.x), "", .x))) %>% 
        mutate(Links = purrr::map2(icon, link, fa_link)) %>% 
        select(-icon, -link)

schedule %>%
    gt(groupname_col = "Day",
       caption = "General schedule for the 3 days of the course.") %>%
    tab_style(style = list(cell_text(weight = "bold")),
              locations = cells_row_groups()) %>%
    tab_style(style = list(cell_text(weight = "bold")),
              locations = cells_column_labels())
```
